results.title: Under Milk Wood
results.creator_credit: Andrew Sinclair, Hugh French, Jules Buck and Timon Films
results.brief_description: Based on the radio play by Dylan Thomas, this film weaves a tapestry of words around the lives and dreams of the inhabitants of the tiny Welsh village of Llareggub. Cast includes Richard Burton as the first voice, Elizabeth Taylor as Rosie Probert and Peter O’Toole as Captain Cat.

results.title: Empire of the sun
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro Productions
results.brief_description: Jim Graham, a young Briton living a comfortable life in Shanghai, is separated from his parents following the Japanese invasion of China at the start of World War II. The separation leads to Jim being caught in an internment camp where he has to fend for himself. Cast includes John Malkovich, Christian Bale, Miranda Richardson and Nigel Havers. Based on the autobiographical novel by J. G. Ballard.

results.title: Mad Max (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Byron Kennedy, Kennedy Miller Productions and Mad Max Films
results.brief_description: Mad Max marked the debut of Australian director George Miller and his first collaboration with Mel Gibson. Part science fiction, part road movie, “Mad Max” is a futuristic vision of a post-apocalyptic Australia where ordered society is fast disintegrating into violent chaos. In this anarchic setting, rogue gangs menacingly roam the land in search of petrol (a vital and increasingly scarce resource), spoils of looting and bloodthirsty fun. Mel Gibson stars as Max Rockatansky, a good cop made mad by the death of his wife and child and the hands of a gang of feral bikies. The film follows Max as he embarks on a personal vendetta to avenge the death of his family, armed with anger, a gun and his car - “the last of the V-8 interceptors”. “Mad Max” has a much-imitated visual and thematic style - gang members are clad in filthy rags with maimed bodies; the landscape is bleak and featureless; camps are transitory pit-stops between war zones; and machines rule their owners. “Mad Max”, with its ordinary hero and car culture narrative, fits neatly into the zeitgeist of 1970s filmmaking. A nihilistic road movie, fuelled by male angst, “Mad Max” is a thrilling, truly original film that remains a highlight of Australian film history.

results.title: Oliver (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, John Wolf, Columbia, Romulus Films and Warwick
results.brief_description: Perhaps the best loved of all family pictures, “Oliver” is a joyous and entertaining version of Dickens’ “Oliver Twist”. Mark Lester plays Oliver, the foundling who escapes the indignities of the workhouse to find success and happiness in the London underworld. Oliver’s new friends include the Artful Dodger and Fagin who teach him to “pick a pocket”. Star roles are played by Harry Secombe, Oliver Reed and Shani Wallis.

results.title: The Little Mermaid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Musker, Ron Clements, Howard Ashman and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Mermaids are supposed to stay under the sea, but there was never a mermaid quite like Ariel. The headstrong teenager longs to be part of the magical world on land, much to the dismay of her father, King Triton. When she falls in love with a human Prince, Ariel looks to Ursula, a sea witch. With the help of her friends, Ariel must win her prince’s love in a thrilling race against time. This production of “The Little Mermaid” based on the fairytale by Hans Christian Andersen is full of dazzling animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Musker, Ron Clements, Howard Ashman and Walt Disney

results.title: Klute
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Her name is Bree Daniels. She’s a tough, high-priced call girl picking her way through the tangled lives that touch hers in the dark maze of New York. Bree once crossed paths with a vicious psychotic killer, who is now stalking her. The only person that can save her is Detective John Klute. Stars Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland. Excellent adult thriller with attention to detail and emphasis on character.

results.title: La Gioconda
results.creator_credit: Hugo Kach, Filippo Sanjust and Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Set in the 17th Century, a ballad singer attempts to save her mother and win the love of her Genoese Prince by becoming involved in the elopement of two lovers. Performers include: Eva Marton, Placido Domingo, Matteo Manuguerra, Ludmila Semtschuk, Kurt Rydl. Vienna State Opera (Vienna) conducted by Adam Fischer. Text by Arrigo Boito after Victor Hugo. Music by Amilcare Ponchielli.

results.title: Madama Butterfly
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Giulio Chazalettes and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: For an opera which in its original form met with derision, Puccini’s “Madam Butterfly” has more than proved those critics wrong. It is now one of the standard and favourite works adored by opera-lovers everywhere. Its themes of love and heartbreak are common in almost every human experience and its plethora of beautiful melodies make it immediately attractive to audiences everywhere. The orchestra of the Arena is conducted by Maurizio Arena.

results.title: Threads
results.creator_credit: Mick Jackson, BBC, Publishing and Broadcasting and Western World
results.brief_description: It’s a normal Thursday in Sheffield when East and West stumble into war and Britain is devastated by 200 megatons of nuclear explosive. This chilling story tells the story of a nuclear strike on Britain. Through the eyes of two Sheffield families, we witness the immediate after effects of the attack - the shock, grief, radiation sickness, hypothermia and starvation. In the following months, hideous injuries remain untreated, looters are shot on sight, food supplies run out and many die in the intense cold of the nuclear winter. Thirteen years on a depopulated Britain living below subsistence level is revealed - a devastated economy where money has no value, crops fail through lack of pesticides, fuel and machinery, and a brutalised postwar generation grows up stunted mentally, physically and emotionally. The fragile fibres that hold society together - the threads - have been completely destroyed and there is no outside aid.

results.title: La Traviata
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Tarak Ben Ammar, Accent Films and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This is Zeffirelli’s lavish production of Verdi’s much-loved opera, “La Traviata”, starring Teresa Stratas and Placido Domingo. Violetta Valery is giving a party to celebrate her return to society after an illness - here she meets Alfredo, son of a wealthy merchant, and they fall in love. They live happily together until Alfredo’s father comes to Violetta and asks her to end the affair in order to spare his family further dishonour. The heartbreak destroys Violetta’s health completely, and Alfredo realises what Violetta has sacrificed - but it is too late!
